content: What 19th-century novel by Charles Dickens features the character of Pip, an orphan who becomes a gentleman through an anonymous benefactor?

The novel you're referring to is "Great Expectations" by Charles Dickens. It was first published in serial form in 1860-1861 and tells the story of Philip Pirrip, or Pip, an orphan who rises in social class through the help of an anonymous benefactor, later revealed to be the convict Abel Magwitch. The novel explores themes of guilt, identity, and social class in Victorian England.
